fear.bodyLanguage: Head and eyes up, shoulders back but relaxed. Assertive.
fear.oppositeAction: Do something you know will give you a sense of control & mastery. If you're able to step back for a few moments, do so and remember a situation where you truly felt in control.

anger.options: anger, angry, mad, pissed off, pissed, livid
anger.bodyLanguage: Unclench hands. Relax chest and stomach. Unclench teeth. Relax face.
anger.oppositeAction: Take a time out. Be kind. Be understanding. It's OK to avoid the person or situation that makes you mad (if appropriate). If you can't avoid, enter the situation / conversation with understanding and kindness.
anger.breathing: If you can go for a sprint or similar physical exertion, do it!

envy.oppositeAction: Think of something you are thankful for. Focus on the good in your life rather than the things you don't posess (people, things, feelings, opportunities, etc). Realize 'the grass is greener' is usually a myth.

jealous.oppositeAction: Let go of controlling other's actions. Share the things and people you have in your life. Appreciate and feel proud of the good things that you do have, even if they seem small or unrelated to the situation at hand.

sad.options: sad, sadness, like crying, upset, depressed
sad.bodyLanguage: Adopt a bright posture. Head up, eyes open, shoulders back.
sad.oppositeAction: Don't avoid. Be mindful of sadness but also think of pleasant events. Think of a few things you're super thankful to have in your life (people, places, things, anything really).
sad.breathing: 'Breathe in' the pleasant events and 'breathe out' the sadness. Don't try to get rid of it, rather allow it to coexist with whatever pleasant thoughts you have.

shame.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Broaden your shoulders. Take a 'confident stance' by widening your posture all together.
shame.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Think of a few things you feel proud about. Pride is the key here - shame wants you to curl up and submit but combatting it with pride you can stomp it in the face!
shame.breathing: If you have some time to explore the shame with someone you trust you can, but in the moment the best thing to do is adopt a proud posture and think of moments of pride.

stress.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
stress.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

happy.message: Feeling happy is obviously the goal, so let's keep it this way!
